title: Drawing, "Study of Classical Sculpture of the "Venus Pudica" Type", ca. 1475
medium: Silverpoint, heightened with white gouache on prepared paper
inscribed: Upper right corner, written in ink "34" or "54", probobaly in the 16th century.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Figure shown from the back. The right leg is shown down to the knee. The left leg is shorter in length and broken irregularly. A wedge, possibly a fragment of the sculpture, connects the leg with a square block. The reverse is not grounded.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study of Classical Sculpture of the "Venus Pudica" Type", ca. 1475.
ca. 1475. Silverpoint, heightened with white gouache on prepared paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2971.
